item.title: Battlefield 6 Update 1.1.3.6 Fixes Movement, Maps, and Crashes
item.content:encoded:
Updates have been announced for Battlefield 6 in version 1.1.3.6

The Battlefield Communications team shared news of major updates that not only address regular quality-of-life improvements but also address reliability issues and gameplay flow.

The update, scheduled to go live on February 3, addresses issues in REDSEC Battle Royale related to parachute behavior, insertions, and other redeploy UI elements.

Another major update listed is a fix to player movement issues, including excessive Sprint jumps and unintended movements. It is emphasized that this will not affect movement on a large scale but will address the specific issues reported by players.

Map and Mode Fixes Coming to Battlefield 6 in New Updates

Map and mode issues are also addressed. Three issues related to Eastwood have been fixed. First, the issue of drawing a building near the A flag, which caused unintended green and purple visual effects, has been addressed. Also, the issue where destroying the B flag could potentially cause a blackout has been fixed.

Additionally, the update addresses a PlayStation 5 issue where ownership validation failed during system events, causing connectivity problems. Plus, the update has resolved an out-of-memory crash on Xbox Series S when loading Daily and Weekly Challenges.

Other issues related to the Battle Royale mode and other areas have been addressed. Players can check out the full statement here.

Do these quality of life improvements make you want to play more Battlefield 6? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Does Nioh 3 Have Early Access? Demo Status, Explained
item.content:encoded:
It’s been a few years since the last Nioh game. Team Ninja has been sharpening its blades and skills with other projects, but it’s time for the company’s main Soulslike to return. The latest information on Nioh 3’s early access is interesting.

The question of Nioh being the best non-FromSoftware series rages on. The Nioh franchise is dripping in Yokai-infested excellence, and each game is more refined than the last. Nioh 3 has gone bigger and bolder with its open-world approach, and it’s no wonder that so many of you want it now.

Is There Nioh 3 Early Access?

Team Ninja is not offering early access as an incentive for Nioh 3 early adopters.

Why should people who pay a bit more get to see those game-over screens sooner? This is the motto for Nioh 3, as even though the game has multiple editions, none of them feature an early access bonus.

There are cool perks, such as a Season Pass and exclusive gear, but you get to use them on Nioh 3’s launch day—like everyone else.

Does Nioh 3 Have A Demo?

If you simply need to play Nioh 3 before release, there is a lengthy demo you can download for free on all applicable gaming platforms.

There’s no Xbox version of Nioh 3, sadly, but if you are on PC or PS5, you can download a free demo to give you a fairly hefty look at the game, how it plays, and if it’s for you.

How To Download Nioh 3 Demo

Go to the PlayStation Store or Steam, search for Nioh 3, and you can buy and download the free Nioh 3 demo.

Thousands of players have already left glowing reviews for the Nioh 3 demo. If you want to try it yourself, follow these steps:

  1. Decide if you’re playing on PlayStation 5 or PC.
  2. Go to the PlayStation Store on PS5 or Steam for PC.
  3. Search for Nioh 3 Demo.
  4. Add it to your library on either format.
  5. Once it’s finished downloading, you can get stuck in!

Here’s even more good news for you: Your Nioh 3 demo progress will carry over to the full game. It’s the equivalent of starting the full game and making a dent in potential progress.

Will the Nioh 3 demo keep you going until February 6? Or are you going to replay an older Nioh or wait patiently for the third game in the meantime? Head to the free-to-join Insider Gaming Discord Server to let everyone know and discuss Team Ninja‘s epic series in general.

Don’t miss out on our Nioh 3 Review Embargo Date guide, as the Insider Gaming article counts down the seconds until the big review day.

item.title: Fortnite Teases Brand New Collaboration
item.content:encoded:
Fortnite is teasing a new collaboration with Mihoyo’s Honkai Star Rail.

Collaborations in Fortnite are always a big topic in the community, with players always looking at leaks and rumours for the next big crossover. At the moment, we are already seeing names like Overwatch and Minecraft coming to the battle royale title. Now, it seems another popular game is on its way.

Fortnite’s Next Collaboration is With Honkai Star Rail

Epic Games Store has posted a new image on X (formerly Twitter) featuring two swords and the caption, “Who’s trailblazing their way to Fortnite.” Excited fans in the comments have already started making their guesses in the comments, with most of them shouting Fortnite x Honkai Star Rail. Moreover, a reliable Fortnite leaks source, ShiinaBR, has confirmed that the collaboration is indeed with Mihoyo’s free-to-play gacha adventure.

Eagle-eyed fans in the comments have also deciphered who these swords belong to in the game. The gold and black sword seemingly belongs to Blade, and the katana with the red blade appears to belong to Kafka. Due to these two swords being showcased, fans are speculating that it could be these two characters that make it to Fortnite in the next collab. However, this hasn’t been officially confirmed by the devs.

In other news, Fortnite dev is teasing a ‘fun’ update to ‘spice up’ the current season. Additionally, check out Insider Gaming’s guide on all of Kenny’s quests in Fortnite. What are your thoughts on Honkai Star Rail coming to Fortnite? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about the former Skyrim lead stating that an Elder Scrolls TV show won’t work. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Today’s Wordle #1687: Hints and Answer for January 31, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you’re a beginner or a daily player, today’s tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak—if you’re open to a little extra help. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Wordle, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1687 for January 31, 2026

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s and yesterday’s editions of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There is currently no app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, January 31, 2026

The Wordle answer for game #1687 isn’t as hard as the last puzzle, but that doesn’t mean it’s easy. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today’s answer takes an average of 4.8 of 6 guesses. That makes it slightly easier than the 5.5-guess average from January 29.

General Wordle Hints For January 31

Without giving today’s Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: This word is most often used as a verb, not a noun.
  • Hint 2: It’s commonly tied to distribution or limits.
  • Hint 3: The action described usually involves deciding portions rather than creating something new.
  • Hint 4: You’ll often see it in rules, plans, or instructions.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1687 for January 31, 2026.

Starter Words For January 31, 2026

If you want help getting started without having today’s Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • ALONE
  • TOTAL
  • FLOAT
  • ALLOW

Today’s Wordle Answer For Game #1687 On January 31, 2026

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: ALLOT

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

What Does Today’s Wordle Answer Mean?

ALLOT is a verb that means “to divide or distribute by share or portion; distribute or parcel out.”

Yesterday’s Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here’s yesterday’s Wordle answer for Game #1686 on January 30, 2026

Answer: JUMBO

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1687?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on February 1 will be Wordle Game #1688.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn’t fully released until 2021. The game challenges players to guess a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

For even more Insider Gaming delivered straight to your inbox, sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Mike has been covering the gaming industry since 2012, and has reported on some of the largest events in the industry while also working as an investigative reporter. Outside of…
